title: AC blowing warm air even though compressor runs
symptoms: Indoor unit fan is running but air is not cold
Outdoor unit compressor is humming or running
Thermostat set to cool and low temperature
possible_causes: Low refrigerant charge due to leak
Restricted metering device (TXV/capillary)
Dirty indoor evaporator coil
Failing compressor valves
recommended_actions: Check and replace air filter if dirty
Inspect indoor coil area for heavy dust/ice buildup
Do not attempt to add refrigerant yourself; contact licensed HVAC technician
Shut unit down if frost or ice is forming on lines to prevent damage

title: AC short cycling (turns on and off frequently)
symptoms: System starts, runs briefly, then shuts off
Compressor and fan cycle every few minutes
Home never reaches set temperature
possible_causes: Oversized AC unit for the space
Dirty condenser coil causing high pressure shutoff
Faulty thermostat placement (near vent or sunlight)
Low refrigerant charge or pressure switch issue
recommended_actions: Clean debris from outdoor condenser coil and ensure proper airflow
Verify thermostat is not near heat sources or supply vents
Replace thermostat batteries if present
If short cycling continues, have technician check pressures and safety switches

title: Indoor unit making whistling or high-pitched noise
symptoms: Whistling from supply vents when AC runs
Noise changes when filter is removed
Some rooms have very strong airflow, others weak
possible_causes: Filter too restrictive or clogged
Closed or undersized return air grilles
Duct leaks pulling air through small gaps
Improperly installed register dampers
recommended_actions: Try a clean filter with lower MERV rating if existing one is very restrictive
Open return grilles and supply registers fully
Inspect visible ducts for disconnected joints or gaps
If whistling continues, have HVAC tech evaluate duct design and static pressure

title: Outdoor unit fan not running but compressor is hot
symptoms: You hear humming from outdoor unit but fan blade is still
Top of unit feels very hot to touch
Breakers may trip after some time
possible_causes: Failed condenser fan motor
Bad dual run capacitor
Obstructed fan blade or debris inside unit
recommended_actions: Turn power off immediately at disconnect to avoid compressor damage
Look down into unit (with power off) for sticks or debris blocking fan
Do not push fan by hand with power applied
Call professional to test/replace fan motor and capacitor

title: Water dripping from indoor unit or ceiling
symptoms: Water stains on ceiling near air handler
Dripping from bottom of indoor unit
AC stops working when float switch triggers
possible_causes: Clogged condensate drain line
Damaged or rusted drain pan
Improper slope of drain piping
recommended_actions: Turn AC off to prevent further water damage
If accessible, use wet/dry vacuum on drain line outside to remove clog
Pour small amount of vinegar into drain access port to clean algae
For repeated leaks, have technician inspect pan and drain routing

title: AC runs but house very humid
symptoms: Air feels sticky even when temperature is low
Windows may show condensation
Short cooling cycles with little run time
possible_causes: Oversized AC that cools too quickly without dehumidifying
Fan set to ON instead of AUTO, re-evaporating moisture
Low refrigerant or poor airflow reducing latent capacity
recommended_actions: Set thermostat fan mode to AUTO so blower stops between cycles
Ensure filters and coils are clean for proper airflow
Consider adding dedicated dehumidifier for very humid climates
Have HVAC professional check charge and system sizing if humidity persists

title: Breaker trips when AC starts
symptoms: Circuit breaker trips immediately or after few seconds of start
Outdoor unit may shake hard at startup
Sometimes works after reset, then trips again
possible_causes: Shorted compressor or fan motor
Weak breaker or undersized wiring
Hard-starting compressor drawing high inrush current
Loose electrical connections at contactor or lugs
recommended_actions: Do not continuously reset breaker; this can be dangerous
Visually inspect for burnt wires in disconnect (with power off)
Call licensed technician to test compressor and wiring, and consider hard-start kit if appropriate
Electrician may be needed if wiring/breaker sizing is incorrect

title: Room AC (window/portable) freezes into a block of ice
symptoms: Evaporator coil covered in ice
Airflow becomes very weak from front grille
Unit may leak water when ice melts
possible_causes: Very dirty filter or evaporator coil
Fan speed too low with very cold setting
Low refrigerant charge or thermostat stuck
Running AC in very low ambient temperature
recommended_actions: Turn unit off and let all ice melt completely
Clean or replace air filter and vacuum coil fins gently
Run on medium fan speed and avoid setting thermostat to coldest position all the time
If icing repeats often, service by technician to check refrigerant and controls

title: Mini-split indoor unit dripping water from front cover
symptoms: Water drops from front panel or louvers
No visible leak from drain line outside
Happens especially on very humid days
possible_causes: Dirty or partially blocked drain pan outlet
Improper leveling of indoor unit
Insufficient insulation on refrigerant lines causing condensation
Fan speed too low causing coil to ice
recommended_actions: Clean filters and run fan-only mode to dry coil
Check that indoor unit is slightly tilted toward drain side
Have technician flush drain and inspect insulation on line set
Increase fan speed and avoid extremely low setpoints

title: Outdoor unit very noisy (rattling or metal-on-metal)
symptoms: Loud rattling or grinding heard outside
Noise increases when fan speeds up
Unit may vibrate strongly
possible_causes: Loose fan blade or motor mounts
Debris caught in fan or grille
Loose sheet metal panels
Failing compressor with mechanical noise
recommended_actions: Turn power off and inspect top and side panels for looseness; tighten screws if safe
Look for sticks, rocks, or ice inside fan area
If noise seems from compressor body, shut system down and call professional
Do not operate unit if metal grinding or burning smell is present
